Name: DKT-065
Item Stem:
Welcome to the Driver Knowledge Test.

You will be asked 45 questions. You are allowed 3 questions wrong in the first section, 'General Knowledge' and only 1 question wrong in either 'Road Safety' or 'Road Signs' sections.

Name: DKT-066
Item Stem: Seat belts and child restraints (eg baby capsules and child seats) -
Answer 1: Must always be worn properly, and adjusted tightly.
Answer 2: Are only needed on long trips.
Answer 3: Are only needed on short trips.

Name: DKT-063
Item Stem: What will happen if you are caught cheating on the knowledge test?
Answer 1: You will not be allowed to take another test for 6 weeks.
Answer 2: You will never be allowed to take another test.
Answer 3: Nothing, there is no penalty.

Name: DKT-064
Item Stem: What will happen if you offer a testing officer a bribe to pass your driving test?
Answer 1: Action will be taken against you. The penalties are severe and include fines and imprisonment.
Answer 2: Only the testing officer will be investigated.
Answer 3: Nothing, there is no penalty.

Name: DKT-006
Item Stem: Where there is parallel kerbside parking, are you allowed to double-park alongside a parked vehicle?
Answer 1: No, not at any time.
Answer 2: Yes, if delivering goods.
Answer 3: Yes, if not obstructing traffic.

Name: DKT-040
Item Stem: What is meant by this sign on or near a bridge?
Answer 1: Slow down and be prepared to give way to vehicles travelling in the opposite direction.
Answer 2: Stop at all times before crossing the bridge and only give way to pedestrians who may be crossing.
Answer 3: Do not overtake a vehicle travelling in the same direction.

Name: DKT-001
Item Stem: A friend lends you his car. It is very noisy and blows a lot of smoke. He tells you the vehicle has been given a defect notice but it's still OK to drive it. What should you do?
Answer 1: Borrow the car, but always drive it 10 Km/h below the speed limit.
Answer 2: Borrow the car but only drive on streets where the car will not be a danger to others.
Answer 3: Before you borrow the car check the defect notice to make sure it is legal to drive the car.

Name: DKT-023
Item Stem: Are you required to carry your driver's licence with you every time you drive?
Answer 1: No, being licensed is enough.
Answer 2: Yes.
Answer 3: No, it is only needed on long trips.

Name: DKT-016
Item Stem: A friend lends you a van that has seats for ten passengers. What type of licence do you need to drive this type of vehicle?
Answer 1: A heavy rigid vehicle licence.
Answer 2: A small bus licence.
Answer 3: A car licence.

Name: DKT-035
Item Stem: Can a P1 or P2 provisional driver legally instruct a learner driver?
Answer 1: No.
Answer 2: Yes, provided the provisional driver has held a P2 licence for more than 6 months.
Answer 3: Yes, provided L and P1 or P2 plates are displayed.

Name: DKT-036
Item Stem: To progress to a P2 provisional licence, a P1 provisional driver must hold a P1 licence for a minimum period of -
Answer 1: 12 months.
Answer 2: 18 months.
Answer 3: 24 months.

Name: DKT-003
Item Stem: Are you permitted to park in the direction of the arrow?
Answer 1: Yes, if you are carrying two or more passengers.
Answer 2: Yes, provided no taxis are using the area.
Answer 3: No, not at any time.

Name: DKT-038
Item Stem: If there are no lanes marked on the road, you should drive -
Answer 1: Near to the left-hand side of the road.
Answer 2: Anywhere on your side of the road.
Answer 3: Along the middle of the road.

Name: DKT-009
Item Stem: You are driving your vehicle along a street and want to stop for a short time. Are you allowed to double park your vehicle (that is stand it on the road alongside a parked car)?
Answer 1: Yes, provided you stop for a short time only and turn on your hazard warning lights.
Answer 2: No, never.
Answer 3: Yes, provided you do not leave the vehicle.

Name: DKT-039
Item Stem: If you intend to turn left, are you required to give a signal?
Answer 1: Yes, if turn signals are fitted to your vehicle.
Answer 2: No, if turning left from a lane marked left turn only.
Answer 3: No, if arrows are marked on the roadway.

Name: DKT-042
Item Stem: How close can you park to another vehicle when parked parallel to the kerb?
Answer 1: You must leave at least 1 metre front and back.
Answer 2: You must leave at least 2 metres from the front only.
Answer 3: You must leave at least 3 metres front and back.

Name: DKT-037
Item Stem: If one or two of your wheels run off the edge of the roadway, you should -
Answer 1: Slow down gradually and ease back onto the road.
Answer 2: Slow down quickly by braking hard.
Answer 3: Increase your speed and drive back on the road.

Name: DKT-041
Item Stem: When reversing, you should -
Answer 1: Take care and never reverse for a greater distance and time than is necessary.
Answer 2: Unbuckle your seat belt so you can reverse as quickly as possible.
Answer 3: Sound your horn to warn other drivers.

Name: DKT-033
Item Stem: When reversing, you should -
Answer 1: Sound your horn to warn other drivers.
Answer 2: Unbuckle your seat belt so you can reverse as quickly as possible.
Answer 3: Take care and never reverse for a greater distance and time than is necessary.

Name: DKT-026
Item Stem: Looking at the diagrams, how far from the approach side of a bus stop or a railway crossing are you allowed to stand or park your vehicle?
Answer 1: At least 20 metres.
Answer 2: At least 50 metres.
Answer 3: At least 5 metres.

Name: DKT-004
Item Stem: If your vehicle is involved in an accident (regardless of the damage), what details must you give, to the other driver(s), if asked?
Answer 1: No details at all until you have contacted your insurance company.
Answer 2: You must let them see your licence, take details, and give the name and address of the vehicle's owner.
Answer 3: Only your name and address details if a Policeman asks for them.

Name: DKT-044
Item Stem: You must give way to pedestrians on a marked pedestrian crossing -
Answer 1: If there is any danger of a collision.
Answer 2: When they are crossing from your right only.
Answer 3: When they are crossing from your left only.

Name: DKT-013
Item Stem: Are you permitted to park on a median strip or traffic island?
Answer 1: No, not at any time.
Answer 2: Yes, in daylight hours.
Answer 3: Yes, but for no more than 30 minutes.

Name: DKT-048
Item Stem: Driving faster than the maximum speed limit is -
Answer 1: Never legally permitted.
Answer 2: Permitted only when passing another vehicle.
Answer 3: Only permitted when other vehicles are going faster than the speed limit.

Name: DKT-029
Item Stem: When you see the headlights flashing on the front of a bus, what should you do?
Answer 1: Be careful, there may be children about.
Answer 2: Drive past the bus only while the lights are flashing.
Answer 3: Stop and wait for the lights to stop flashing.

Name: DKT-030
Item Stem: Before driving a long distance at fast speed or carrying a full car load, you should -
Answer 1: Have a large meal and a cup of coffee.
Answer 2: Check your tyre pressure, and if necessary, increase it to what the manufacturer recommends.
Answer 3: Make sure you have a street directory, so you know where you are going.

Name: DKT-052
Item Stem: To reduce the effect of alcohol before driving or riding you should -
Answer 1: Wait. The time depends on how much you have drunk.
Answer 2: Drink black coffee.
Answer 3: Have a glass of water.

Name: DKT-007
Item Stem: You should use your right-hand indicator when -
Answer 1: You are about to stop.
Answer 2: You intend to slow down.
Answer 3: You intend to move to the right, at any time.

Name: DKT-067
Item Stem: The most effective device for protecting passengers when in an accident is -
Answer 1: Seat belts.
Answer 2: Safety door latches.
Answer 3: Padded instrument panels.

Name: DKT-054
Item Stem: If you take medicine and then drink alcohol -
Answer 1: It can have a particularly bad effect on your driving ability.
Answer 2: The alcohol will have less effect than if taken alone.
Answer 3: Your ability to react to emergencies will improve.

Name: DKT-012
Item Stem: You borrow a friend's car and find that the position of the driver's seat puts you sitting a long way from the steering wheel and controls. What should you do?
Answer 1: Ask your friend for a cushion to place behind your back.
Answer 2: Put up with the discomfort; you should not adjust another person's seat.
Answer 3: Adjust the seat forward so it's right for you.

Name: DKT-019
Item Stem: You should be particularly careful at this intersection because -
Answer 1: The building blocks a good view of the side street.
Answer 2: Intersections cause crashes.
Answer 3: It looks a bit tricky.

Name: DKT-045
Item Stem: When approaching a marked pedestrian crossing and no pedestrians are in sight, you should -
Answer 1: Slow down and be ready to make a safe stop.
Answer 2: Come to a complete stop before the crossing.
Answer 3: Go faster, in case a pedestrian steps onto the crossing.

Name: DKT-046
Item Stem: A car is carrying a driver and 3 adult passengers. There are seat belts in all seating positions. By law, seat belts must be worn by -
Answer 1: All four people.
Answer 2: Only the driver.
Answer 3: Only the driver and front seat passenger.

Name: DKT-005
Item Stem: When you see these lights flashing on the back of a bus, what should you do?
Answer 1: Overtake the bus only while the lights are flashing.
Answer 2: Drive carefully at no more than 40 km/h.
Answer 3: Stop and wait for the lights to stop flashing.

Name: DKT-047
Item Stem: The adult passenger in the rear is breaking the law because she is -
Answer 1: Not wearing the available seat belt.
Answer 2: Sitting in the back seat.
Answer 3: Distracting the driver.

Name: DKT-053
Item Stem: Is it an offence to refuse to take a POLICE breath test?
Answer 1: Yes - always.
Answer 2: No - if you say you haven't been drinking alcohol.
Answer 3: No - if you are a learner driver.

Name: DKT-049
Item Stem: What is your maximum speed limit if you are driving a vehicle with a GVM over 4.5 tonnes?
Answer 2: 90 km/h.

Name: DKT-055
Item Stem: If you are taking any sort of medicine, you should -
Answer 1: Find out from your doctor or chemist whether the medicine or drug will affect your driving and act accordingly.
Answer 2: Only drive during the day after taking the medicine or drug.
Answer 3: Only drive a motor car not a heavy vehicle.

Name: DKT-027
Item Stem: You see a broken yellow line painted on the roadway adjacent to the kerb. What does it mean?
Answer 1: You may at any time, park along this part of the road for 1 hour only.
Answer 2: Clearway restrictions apply - you must not stop during the clearway hours.
Answer 3: Bicycle riders must ride along the yellow line.

Name: DKT-059
Item Stem: This sign means you should -
Answer 1: Pass to the left of the sign.
Answer 2: Turn left at next street.
Answer 3: Drive carefully, roundabout ahead.

Name: DKT-060
Item Stem: What does this sign mean?
Answer 1: All right lane traffic must turn right at the next intersection.
Answer 2: Right lane traffic may turn right or go straight ahead at the next intersection.
Answer 3: One way traffic ahead.

Name: DKT-061
Item Stem: What does this here sign mean?
Answer 1: Traffic travels in each direction.
Answer 2: No turns permitted.
Answer 3: Double lane bridge ahead.

Name: DKT-062
Item Stem: What does this actual sign mean?
Answer 1: You must not turn to the right.
Answer 2: You may turn to the right.
Answer 3: You must give way to traffic on your right.

Name: DKT-022
Item Stem: Where there are double dividing lines, you may park -
Answer 1: One metre from the dividing lines.
Answer 2: At least three metres from the dividing lines.
Answer 3: At least two metres from the dividing lines.

Name: DKT-011
Item Stem: You hold an unrestricted licence and are driving at 100 km/h in the country and pass this sign. What should you do?
Answer 1: For the next 5 kilometres you must not exceed 60 km/h unless you pass an end farm animals speed limit sign.
Answer 2: Slow down to a speed that will allow you to stop to avoid crashing into farm animals on the road.
Answer 3: You can continue to drive at 100 km/h if there are fences to stop farm animals from getting on the road.

Name: DKT-032
Item Stem: If you are driving through a road work zone in the left hand lane and you see this sign you should -
Answer 1: Merge to the right and give way to other traffic.
Answer 2: Speed up to get in front of any cars travelling in the right hand lane.
Answer 3: Stop and wait for directions.

Name: DKT-008
Item Stem: Stop signs or flashing lights at railway crossings should always be obeyed, because -
Answer 1: Car brakes often fail.
Answer 2: Trains are fast, heavy and cannot stop quickly.
Answer 3: Pedestrians might be crossing.

Name: DKT-058
Item Stem: When you see this sign you should -
Answer 1: Not drive beyond the sign.
Answer 2: Drive with caution.
Answer 3: Not pass another vehicle.

Name: DKT-040
Item Stem: What is meant by this sign on or near a bridge?
Answer 1: Slow down and be prepared to give way to vehicles travelling in the opposite direction.
Answer 2: Stop at all times before crossing the bridge and only give way to pedestrians who may be crossing.
Answer 3: Do not overtake a vehicle travelling in the same direction.
Correct: Stop at all times before crossing the bridge and only give way to pedestrians who may be crossing.

Name: DKT-001
Item Stem: A friend lends you his car. It is very noisy and blows a lot of smoke. He tells you the vehicle has been given a defect notice but it's still OK to drive it. What should you do?
Answer 1: Borrow the car, but always drive it 10 Km/h below the speed limit.
Answer 2: Borrow the car but only drive on streets where the car will not be a danger to others.
Answer 3: Before you borrow the car check the defect notice to make sure it is legal to drive the car.
Correct: Before you borrow the car check the defect notice to make sure it is legal to drive the car.

Name: DKT-023
Item Stem: Are you required to carry your driver's licence with you every time you drive?
Answer 1: No, being licensed is enough.
Answer 2: Yes.
Answer 3: No, it is only needed on long trips.
Correct: Yes.

Name: DKT-016
Item Stem: A friend lends you a van that has seats for ten passengers. What type of licence do you need to drive this type of vehicle?
Answer 1: A heavy rigid vehicle licence.
Answer 2: A small bus licence.
Answer 3: A car licence.
Correct: A car licence.

Name: DKT-035
Item Stem: Can a P1 or P2 provisional driver legally instruct a learner driver?
Answer 1: No.
Answer 2: Yes, provided the provisional driver has held a P2 licence for more than 6 months.
Answer 3: Yes, provided L and P1 or P2 plates are displayed.
Correct: Yes, provided the provisional driver has held a P2 licence for more than 6 months.

Name: DKT-036
Item Stem: To progress to a P2 provisional licence, a P1 provisional driver must hold a P1 licence for a minimum period of -
Answer 1: 12 months.
Answer 2: 18 months.
Answer 3: 24 months.
Correct: 24 months.

Name: DKT-003
Item Stem: Are you permitted to park in the direction of the arrow?
Answer 1: Yes, if you are carrying two or more passengers.
Answer 2: Yes, provided no taxis are using the area.
Answer 3: No, not at any time.
Correct: No, not at any time.

Name: DKT-038
Item Stem: If there are no lanes marked on the road, you should drive -
Answer 1: Near to the left-hand side of the road.
Answer 2: Anywhere on your side of the road.
Answer 3: Along the middle of the road.
Correct: Near to the left-hand side of the road.

Name: DKT-009
Item Stem: You are driving your vehicle along a street and want to stop for a short time. Are you allowed to double park your vehicle (that is stand it on the road alongside a parked car)?
Answer 1: Yes, provided you stop for a short time only and turn on your hazard warning lights.
Answer 2: No, never.
Answer 3: Yes, provided you do not leave the vehicle.
Correct: No, never.

Name: DKT-039
Item Stem: If you intend to turn left, are you required to give a signal?
Answer 1: Yes, if turn signals are fitted to your vehicle.
Answer 2: No, if turning left from a lane marked left turn only.
Answer 3: No, if arrows are marked on the roadway.
Correct: Yes, if turn signals are fitted to your vehicle.

Name: DKT-042
Item Stem: How close can you park to another vehicle when parked parallel to the kerb?
Answer 1: You must leave at least 1 metre front and back.
Answer 2: You must leave at least 2 metres from the front only.
Answer 3: You must leave at least 3 metres front and back.
Correct: You must leave at least 1 metre front and back.

Name: DKT-037
Item Stem: If one or two of your wheels run off the edge of the roadway, you should -
Answer 1: Slow down gradually and ease back onto the road.
Answer 2: Slow down quickly by braking hard.
Answer 3: Increase your speed and drive back on the road.
Correct: Slow down gradually and ease back onto the road.

Name: DKT-041
Item Stem: When reversing, you should -
Answer 1: Take care and never reverse for a greater distance and time than is necessary.
Answer 2: Unbuckle your seat belt so you can reverse as quickly as possible.
Answer 3: Sound your horn to warn other drivers.
Correct: Sound your horn to warn other drivers.

Name: DKT-033
Item Stem: When reversing, you should -

Answer 3: Take care and never reverse for a greater distance and time than is necessary.
Correct: Take care and never reverse for a greater distance and time than is necessary.

Name: DKT-026
Item Stem: Looking at the diagrams, how far from the approach side of a bus stop or a railway crossing are you allowed to stand or park your vehicle?
Answer 1: At least 20 metres.
Answer 2: At least 50 metres.
Answer 3: At least 5 metres.
Correct: At least 20 metres.

Name: DKT-004
Item Stem: If your vehicle is involved in an accident (regardless of the damage), what details must you give, to the other driver(s), if asked?
Answer 1: No details at all until you have contacted your insurance company.
Answer 2: You must let them see your licence, take details, and give the name and address of the vehicle's owner.
Answer 3: Only your name and address details if a Policeman asks for them.
Correct: You must let them see your licence, take details, and give the name and address of the vehicle's owner.

Name: DKT-044
Item Stem: You must give way to pedestrians on a marked pedestrian crossing -
Answer 1: If there is any danger of a collision.
Answer 2: When they are crossing from your right only.
Answer 3: When they are crossing from your left only.
Correct: When they are crossing from your right only.

Answer 1: No, not at any time.
Answer 2: Yes, in daylight hours.
Answer 3: Yes, but for no more than 30 minutes.
Correct: No, not at any time.

Answer 2: Permitted only when passing another vehicle.
Answer 3: Only permitted when other vehicles are going faster than the speed limit.
Correct: Never legally permitted.

Name: DKT-029
Item Stem: When you see the headlights flashing on the front of a bus, what should you do?
Answer 1: Drive past the bus only while the lights are flashing.

Answer 3: Be careful, there may be children about.
Correct: Be careful, there may be children about.

Correct: Check your tyre pressure, and if necessary, increase it to what the manufacturer recommends.

Answer 3: Have a glass of water.
Correct: Wait. The time depends on how much you have drunk.

Answer 1: You are about to stop.
Answer 2: You intend to slow down.
Answer 3: You intend to move to the right, at any time.
Correct: You intend to move to the right, at any time.

Correct: It can have a particularly bad effect on your driving ability.

Name: DQT-001
Item Stem: The Driver Qualification Test (DQT) tests your knowledge of safe driving. It also tests your hazard perception skills. You must pass the DQT to qualify for a full NSW license.

Name: DQT-002
Item Stem:
The DQT Consists of two parts.


Part 1 covers Advanced Safe Driving Knowledge and Part 2 Advanced Hazard Perception.

You must successfully complete both parts of the DQT to pass. DQT results are given at the end of the test once you have finished Part 2.

Name: DQT-003
Item Stem:
Part 1 of the DQT consists of 15 multiple-choice questions. Some have text only while some also include a picture or an animaation (a picture that moves). Each question has four possible answers. For each question, you must touch the answer you think is most correct. The answer you select will then turn green. An example is shown in the picture below.

To change you answer, just touch any of the other 3 answer options. When you are sure about your answer, touch the OK button at the bottom right hand corner of the screen. This submits your answer to the computer and moves you on to the next question until Part 1 is completed.

Name: DQT-004
Item Stem: To help you take the real test you will be shown three practice questions. They work just like the real test questions except that after you touch the OK button, a tick will appear next to your answer if you were correct or a red cross if your answer was wrong.

Name: DQT-169
Item Stem:
If you need assistance or explanation of something you do not understand 
during the test, please signal to the registry officer who will assist you.

test fee and you will not be allowed to attempt another test for 6 weeks.

During the test you are NOT allowed to:

Name: DQT-171
Item Stem:
Part 2 of the DQT consists of 10 advanced hazard perception (HP) questions. They are similar to the questions on the HPT that you completed to get your green P, but are longer and may require you to respond to more than one hazard.

Part 2consists of:

  • instructions.
  • 2 practice questions.
  • 10 test questions.
  • test results and feedback.

Name: DQT-172
Item Stem:
You will be presented with 10 traffic situations one at a time and be asked what you would do in each of them. You will see a film clip of each traffic situation shown from the driver's seat.


Before each film clip, you will be told about the traffic situation, and then you will be asked to respond to it by either touching or not touching the screen (eg. Touch the screen each time you would slow down, overtake or make a turn in traffic). You will then need to touch the screen to start and view a film clip of a traffic situation. After you touch the screen, it will stay still for 3 seconds before it starts moving. This will help you understand the situation.

Name: DQT-173
Item Stem:
There is a sound button at the top right of the screen. You can use it at any time - when you use it, you will hear the information on the screen.


You cannot skip any question in Part 2 of the DQT.

Name: DQT-174
Item Stem:
To respond to each traffic situation you will need to touch the screen whenever you think some action is required (eg. Slowing down, overtaking or crossing an intersection).


If you identify different hazards, you may need to touch the screen more than once during any one film clip. However, you only need to touch the screen ONCE FOR EACH HAZARD that you see. For example, if there are three hazards in a particular question you will need to touch the screen only three times - once for each hazard.

Name: DQT-175
Item Stem:
If you think you cannot or should not take any action as it would be unsafe, or no action is needed to stay safe, you should NOT touch the screen.

If you touch the screen, you will hear a sound and the picture will flash briefly. However, the film clip will continue to run, it will NOT slow down or stop when you touch the screen. The computer has registered your response and you must look out for other hazards and opportunites to take the same action.

If you do not touch the screen, the film clip will continue to play to the end and you will not hear any sound or see the screen flash.

Name: DQT-176
Item Stem:
Remember, in some traffic situations the correct response is NOT to touch the screen at all, while in others the correct response is to touch the screen once or more than once where appropriate.


After each film clip in the test you will need to touch the'Next' question button to move on to the next question

Name: DQT-177
Item Stem:
To help you take the real HP questions in Part 2, you will be shown 2 practice questions. They work just like the real test questions except that after each question you get feedback about your response and the chance to repeat the question.


You will be told if your response was good, could have been better or was unsafe.  If it was not good, you will be given the chance to repeat the question. You cannot repeat or skip questions in the real test.

Name: DKT-040
Item Stem: What is meant by this sign on or near a bridge?
Answer 1: Slow down and be prepared to give way to vehicles travelling in the opposite direction.

Item Stem: A friend lends you his car. It is very noisy and blows a lot of smoke. He tells you the vehicle has been given a defect notice but it's still OK to drive it. What should you do?
Answer 1: Borrow the car, but always drive it 10 Km/h below the speed limit.

Answer 2: Yes.
Answer 3: No, it is only needed on long trips.
Correct: Yes.

Answer 2: A small bus licence.
Answer 3: A car licence.

Answer 3: Yes, provided L and P1 or P2 plates are displayed.
Correct: Yes, provided the provisional driver has held a P2 licence for more than 6 months.

Answer 3: No, not at any time.
Correct: No, not at any time.

Answer 2: Anywhere on your side of the road.
Answer 3: Along the middle of the road.

Name: DKT-009

Answer 3: Yes, provided you do not leave the vehicle.
Correct: No, never.

Correct: Yes, if turn signals are fitted to your vehicle.

Correct: You must leave at least 1 metre front and back.

Item Stem: Bạn có bắt buộc phải mang theo bằng lái xe mỗi khi lái xe không?

Name: DKT-016_vietnamese
Item Stem: Một người bạn cho bạn mượn một chiếc xe có chỗ ngồi cho mười hành khách. Loại giấy phép nào bạn cần để lái loại phương tiện này?

Name: DKT-035_vietnamese
Item Stem: Trình điều khiển tạm thời P1 hoặc P2 có thể hướng dẫn một cách hợp pháp cho người học lái xe không?

Name: DKT-036_vietnamese
Item Stem: Để chuyển sang giấy phép tạm thời P2, người lái xe tạm thời P1 phải có giấy phép P1 trong khoảng thời gian tối thiểu là -

Name: DKT-003_vietnamese
Item Stem: Bạn có được phép đỗ theo hướng mũi tên không?
Answer 1: Có, nếu bạn đang chở hai hoặc nhiều hành khách.
Answer 2: Có, với điều kiện không có taxi đang sử dụng khu vực.
Answer 3: Không, không phải bất cứ lúc nào.

Name: DKT-038_vietnamese
Item Stem: Nếu không có làn đường được đánh dấu trên đường, bạn nên lái xe -

Answer 3: Dọc giữa đường.

Name: DKT-009_vietnamese
Item Stem: Bạn đang lái xe dọc theo một con phố và muốn dừng lại trong một thời gian ngắn. Bạn có được phép đỗ xe đôi (đó là đứng trên đường cùng với xe đang đỗ)?
Answer 1: Có, miễn là bạn dừng lại trong một thời gian ngắn và bật đèn cảnh báo nguy hiểm.
Answer 2: Không bao giờ.
Answer 3: Có, với điều kiện bạn không rời khỏi xe.
Correct: Không bao giờ.

Name: DKT-039_vietnamese
Item Stem: Nếu bạn có ý định rẽ trái, bạn có bắt buộc phải đưa ra tín hiệu không?
Answer 1: Có, nếu tín hiệu rẽ được trang bị cho xe của bạn.
Answer 2: Không, nếu rẽ trái từ làn đường được đánh dấu rẽ trái.
Answer 3: Không, nếu mũi tên được đánh dấu trên đường.
Correct: Có, nếu tín hiệu rẽ được trang bị cho xe của bạn.

Name: DKT-042_vietnamese
Item Stem: Làm thế nào gần bạn có thể đỗ xe khác khi đỗ song song với lề đường?
Answer 1: Bạn phải để lại ít nhất 1 mét trước và sau.
Answer 2: Bạn phải để lại ít nhất 2 mét từ phía trước.

Name: DKT-037_vietnamese
Item Stem: Nếu một hoặc hai bánh xe của bạn chạy ra khỏi lề đường, bạn nên -
Answer 1: Chậm lại dần dần và dễ dàng trở lại đường.

Name: DKT-041_vietnamese

Name: DKT-026_vietnamese
Item Stem: Nhìn vào sơ đồ, bạn có thể đứng hoặc đỗ xe cách xa xe của bạn bao xa?

Name: DKT-004_vietnamese
Item Stem: Nếu chiếc xe của bạn có liên quan đến một vụ tai nạn (bất kể thiệt hại), bạn phải cung cấp những chi tiết nào, cho (các) người lái xe khác, nếu được hỏi?

Name: DKT-044_vietnamese
Item Stem: Bạn phải nhường đường cho người đi bộ trên đường dành cho người đi bộ được đánh dấu -

Answer 3: Khi họ đang băng qua từ bên trái của bạn.
Correct: Khi họ đang vượt qua từ bên phải của bạn mà thôi.

Name: DKT-013_vietnamese
Item Stem: Bạn có được phép đỗ xe trên dải phân cách hoặc đảo giao thông không?

Item Stem: Lái xe nhanh hơn giới hạn tốc độ tối đa là -

Name: DKT-029_vietnamese
Item Stem: Khi bạn nhìn thấy đèn pha nhấp nháy ở phía trước của xe buýt, bạn nên làm gì?

Item Stem: Trước khi lái xe đường dài với tốc độ nhanh hoặc chở đầy tải xe, bạn nên -

Name: DKT-052_vietnamese
Item Stem: Để giảm tác dụng của rượu trước khi lái xe hoặc đi xe, bạn nên -

Name: DKT-012_vietnamese
Item Stem: Bạn mượn xe của một người bạn và thấy rằng vị trí ghế lái sẽ khiến bạn ngồi cách xa tay lái và điều khiển. Những gì bạn nên làm?

Correct: Hãy chậm lại và sẵn sàng để dừng lại an toàn.

Name: DKT-046_vietnamese
Item Stem: Một chiếc ô tô đang chở tài xế và 3 hành khách người lớn. Có dây an toàn ở tất cả các vị trí chỗ ngồi. Theo luật, dây an toàn phải được đeo bởi -
Answer 1: Cả bốn người.

Correct: Cả bốn người.

Name: DKT-005_vietnamese
Item Stem: Khi bạn nhìn thấy những ánh đèn này nhấp nháy ở mặt sau của xe buýt, bạn nên làm gì?

Name: DKT-047_vietnamese

Answer 1: Không đeo dây an toàn có sẵn.

Name: DKT-053_vietnamese

Name: DKT-049_vietnamese
Item Stem: Giới hạn tốc độ tối đa của bạn là bao nhiêu nếu bạn đang lái một chiếc xe có GVM trên 4,5 tấn?

Name: DKT-027_vietnamese
Item Stem: Bạn thấy một đường màu vàng bị hỏng vẽ trên con đường sát lề đường. Nó có nghĩa là gì?

Answer 2: Rẽ trái tại đường tiếp theo.
Answer 3: Lái xe cẩn thận, vòng qua phía trước.

Name: DKT-060_vietnamese
Item Stem: Những gì hiện dấu hiệu này có ý nghĩa?

Name: DKT-061_vietnamese

Answer 1: Giao thông đi theo từng hướng.

Answer 3: Cầu đôi làn trước.
Correct: Không được phép rẽ.

Name: DKT-062_vietnamese

Name: DKT-011_vietnamese
Item Stem: Bạn có giấy phép không hạn chế và đang lái xe ở tốc độ 100 km / h trong nước và vượt qua biển báo này. Những gì bạn nên làm?

Answer 1: Sağa birleştir ve diğer trafiğe yol ver.
Answer 2: Sağ şeritte seyahat eden herhangi bir aracın önüne geçmek için hızlandırın.
Answer 3: Dur ve yol tarifi için bekle.
Correct: Sağa birleştir ve diğer trafiğe yol ver.

Name: DKT-008_turkish
Item Stem: Demiryolu geçişlerinde dur işaretleri veya yanıp sönen ışıklar her zaman dikkate alınmalıdır, çünkü -
Answer 1: Araba frenleri çoğu zaman başarısız olur.
Answer 2: Trenler hızlı, ağır ve çabuk duramıyor.
Answer 3: Yayalar geçiyor olabilir.
Correct: Trenler hızlı, ağır ve çabuk duramıyor.

Name: DKT-058_turkish
Item Stem: Bu işareti gördüğünüzde -
Answer 1: İşaretin ötesinde değil.
Answer 2: Dikkatli sür.
Answer 3: Başka bir aracı geçmeyin.
Correct: Başka bir aracı geçmeyin.

Name: DKT-064_turkish
Item Stem: Eğer test bir memur, sürüş testi geçmek için rüşvet teklif ne olacak?
Answer 1: Eylem size karşı alınacaktır. Cezalar ve ağır para cezası ve hapis içerir.
Answer 2: Sadece test memur araştırılır.
Answer 3: Hiçbir şey, hiçbir ceza olduğunu.
Correct: Eylem size karşı alınacaktır. Cezalar ve ağır para cezası ve hapis içerir.

Name: DKT-066
Item Stem: Seat belts and child restraints (eg baby capsules and child seats) -
Answer 1: Must always be worn properly, and adjusted tightly.
Answer 2: Are only needed on long trips.
Answer 3: Are only needed on short trips.
Correct: Must always be worn properly, and adjusted tightly.

Correct: You will not be allowed to take another test for 6 weeks.

Answer 1: Action will be taken against you. The penalties are severe and include fines and imprisonment.

Answer 3: Nothing, there is no penalty.
Correct: Action will be taken against you. The penalties are severe and include fines and imprisonment.

Name: DKT-006
Item Stem: Where there is parallel kerbside parking, are you allowed to double-park alongside a parked vehicle?
Answer 1: No, not at any time.
Answer 2: Yes, if delivering goods.
Answer 3: Yes, if not obstructing traffic.
Correct: No, not at any time.

Name: DKT-040
Item Stem: What is meant by this sign on or near a bridge?
Answer 1: Slow down and be prepared to give way to vehicles travelling in the opposite direction.
Answer 2: Stop at all times before crossing the bridge and only give way to pedestrians who may be crossing.
Answer 3: Do not overtake a vehicle travelling in the same direction.
Correct: Stop at all times before crossing the bridge and only give way to pedestrians who may be crossing.

Name: DKT-001
Item Stem: A friend lends you his car. It is very noisy and blows a lot of smoke. He tells you the vehicle has been given a defect notice but it's still OK to drive it. What should you do?
Answer 1: Borrow the car, but always drive it 10 Km/h below the speed limit.
Answer 2: Borrow the car but only drive on streets where the car will not be a danger to others.
Answer 3: Before you borrow the car check the defect notice to make sure it is legal to drive the car.
Correct: Before you borrow the car check the defect notice to make sure it is legal to drive the car.

Name: DKT-023
Item Stem: Are you required to carry your driver's licence with you every time you drive?
Answer 1: No, being licensed is enough.
Answer 2: Yes.
Answer 3: No, it is only needed on long trips.
Correct: Yes.

Name: DKT-016
Item Stem: A friend lends you a van that has seats for ten passengers. What type of licence do you need to drive this type of vehicle?
Answer 1: A heavy rigid vehicle licence.
Answer 2: A small bus licence.
Answer 3: A car licence.
Correct: A car licence.

Name: DKT-035
Item Stem: Can a P1 or P2 provisional driver legally instruct a learner driver?
Answer 1: No.
Answer 2: Yes, provided the provisional driver has held a P2 licence for more than 6 months.
Answer 3: Yes, provided L and P1 or P2 plates are displayed.
Correct: Yes, provided the provisional driver has held a P2 licence for more than 6 months.

Name: DKT-036
Item Stem: To progress to a P2 provisional licence, a P1 provisional driver must hold a P1 licence for a minimum period of -
Answer 1: 12 months.
Answer 2: 18 months.
Answer 3: 24 months.
Correct: 24 months.

Name: DKT-003
Item Stem: Are you permitted to park in the direction of the arrow?
Answer 1: Yes, if you are carrying two or more passengers.
Answer 2: Yes, provided no taxis are using the area.
Answer 3: No, not at any time.
Correct: No, not at any time.

Name: DKT-038
Item Stem: If there are no lanes marked on the road, you should drive -
Answer 1: Near to the left-hand side of the road.
Answer 2: Anywhere on your side of the road.
Answer 3: Along the middle of the road.
Correct: Near to the left-hand side of the road.

Name: DKT-009
Item Stem: You are driving your vehicle along a street and want to stop for a short time. Are you allowed to double park your vehicle (that is stand it on the road alongside a parked car)?
Answer 1: Yes, provided you stop for a short time only and turn on your hazard warning lights.
Answer 2: No, never.
Answer 3: Yes, provided you do not leave the vehicle.
Correct: No, never.

Name: DKT-039
Item Stem: If you intend to turn left, are you required to give a signal?
Answer 1: Yes, if turn signals are fitted to your vehicle.
Answer 2: No, if turning left from a lane marked left turn only.
Answer 3: No, if arrows are marked on the roadway.
Correct: Yes, if turn signals are fitted to your vehicle.

Name: DKT-042
Item Stem: How close can you park to another vehicle when parked parallel to the kerb?
Answer 1: You must leave at least 1 metre front and back.
Answer 2: You must leave at least 2 metres from the front only.
Answer 3: You must leave at least 3 metres front and back.
Correct: You must leave at least 1 metre front and back.

Name: DKT-037
Item Stem: If one or two of your wheels run off the edge of the roadway, you should -
Answer 1: Slow down gradually and ease back onto the road.
Answer 2: Slow down quickly by braking hard.
Answer 3: Increase your speed and drive back on the road.
Correct: Slow down gradually and ease back onto the road.

Name: DKT-041
Item Stem: When reversing, you should -
Answer 1: Take care and never reverse for a greater distance and time than is necessary.
Answer 2: Unbuckle your seat belt so you can reverse as quickly as possible.
Answer 3: Sound your horn to warn other drivers.
Correct: Sound your horn to warn other drivers.

Name: DKT-033
Item Stem: When reversing, you should -
Answer 1: Sound your horn to warn other drivers.
Answer 2: Unbuckle your seat belt so you can reverse as quickly as possible.
Answer 3: Take care and never reverse for a greater distance and time than is necessary.
Correct: Take care and never reverse for a greater distance and time than is necessary.

Name: DKT-026
Item Stem: Looking at the diagrams, how far from the approach side of a bus stop or a railway crossing are you allowed to stand or park your vehicle?
Answer 1: At least 20 metres.
Answer 2: At least 50 metres.
Answer 3: At least 5 metres.
Correct: At least 20 metres.

Name: DKT-004
Item Stem: If your vehicle is involved in an accident (regardless of the damage), what details must you give, to the other driver(s), if asked?
Answer 1: No details at all until you have contacted your insurance company.
Answer 2: You must let them see your licence, take details, and give the name and address of the vehicle's owner.
Answer 3: Only your name and address details if a Policeman asks for them.
Correct: You must let them see your licence, take details, and give the name and address of the vehicle's owner.

Name: DKT-044
Item Stem: You must give way to pedestrians on a marked pedestrian crossing -
Answer 1: If there is any danger of a collision.
Answer 2: When they are crossing from your right only.
Answer 3: When they are crossing from your left only.
Correct: When they are crossing from your right only.

Name: DKT-013
Item Stem: Are you permitted to park on a median strip or traffic island?
Answer 1: No, not at any time.
Answer 2: Yes, in daylight hours.
Answer 3: Yes, but for no more than 30 minutes.
Correct: No, not at any time.

Name: DKT-048
Item Stem: Driving faster than the maximum speed limit is -
Answer 1: Never legally permitted.
Answer 2: Permitted only when passing another vehicle.
Answer 3: Only permitted when other vehicles are going faster than the speed limit.
Correct: Never legally permitted.

Name: DKT-029
Item Stem: When you see the headlights flashing on the front of a bus, what should you do?
Answer 1: Drive past the bus only while the lights are flashing.
Answer 2: Stop and wait for the lights to stop flashing.
Answer 3: Be careful, there may be children about.
Correct: Be careful, there may be children about.

Name: DKT-030
Item Stem: Before driving a long distance at fast speed or carrying a full car load, you should -
Answer 1: Have a large meal and a cup of coffee.
Answer 2: Check your tyre pressure, and if necessary, increase it to what the manufacturer recommends.
Answer 3: Make sure you have a street directory, so you know where you are going.
Correct: Check your tyre pressure, and if necessary, increase it to what the manufacturer recommends.

Name: DKT-052
Item Stem: To reduce the effect of alcohol before driving or riding you should -
Answer 1: Wait. The time depends on how much you have drunk.
Answer 2: Drink black coffee.
Answer 3: Have a glass of water.
Correct: Wait. The time depends on how much you have drunk.

Name: DKT-007
Item Stem: You should use your right-hand indicator when -
Answer 1: You are about to stop.
Answer 2: You intend to slow down.
Answer 3: You intend to move to the right, at any time.
Correct: You intend to move to the right, at any time.

Name: DKT-067
Item Stem: The most effective device for protecting passengers when in an accident is -
Answer 1: Seat belts.
Answer 2: Safety door latches.
Answer 3: Padded instrument panels.
Correct: Seat belts.

Name: DKT-054
Item Stem: If you take medicine and then drink alcohol -
Answer 1: It can have a particularly bad effect on your driving ability.
Answer 2: The alcohol will have less effect than if taken alone.
Answer 3: Your ability to react to emergencies will improve.
Correct: It can have a particularly bad effect on your driving ability.

Name: DKT-012
Item Stem: You borrow a friend's car and find that the position of the driver's seat puts you sitting a long way from the steering wheel and controls. What should you do?
Answer 1: Ask your friend for a cushion to place behind your back.
Answer 2: Put up with the discomfort; you should not adjust another person's seat.
Answer 3: Adjust the seat forward so it's right for you.
Correct: Adjust the seat forward so it's right for you.

Name: DKT-019
Item Stem: You should be particularly careful at this intersection because -
Answer 1: The building blocks a good view of the side street.
Answer 2: Intersections cause crashes.
Answer 3: It looks a bit tricky.
Correct: The building blocks a good view of the side street.

Name: DKT-045
Item Stem: When approaching a marked pedestrian crossing and no pedestrians are in sight, you should -
Answer 1: Slow down and be ready to make a safe stop.
Answer 2: Come to a complete stop before the crossing.
Answer 3: Go faster, in case a pedestrian steps onto the crossing.
Correct: Slow down and be ready to make a safe stop.

Name: DKT-046
Item Stem: A car is carrying a driver and 3 adult passengers. There are seat belts in all seating positions. By law, seat belts must be worn by -
Answer 1: All four people.
Answer 2: Only the driver.
Answer 3: Only the driver and front seat passenger.
Correct: All four people.

Name: DKT-005
Item Stem: When you see these lights flashing on the back of a bus, what should you do?
Answer 1: Overtake the bus only while the lights are flashing.
Answer 2: Drive carefully at no more than 40 km/h.
Answer 3: Stop and wait for the lights to stop flashing.
Correct: Drive carefully at no more than 40 km/h.

Name: DKT-047
Item Stem: The adult passenger in the rear is breaking the law because she is -
Answer 1: Not wearing the available seat belt.
Answer 2: Sitting in the back seat.
Answer 3: Distracting the driver.
Correct: Not wearing the available seat belt.

Name: DKT-053
Item Stem: Is it an offence to refuse to take a POLICE breath test?
Answer 1: Yes - always.
Answer 2: No - if you say you haven't been drinking alcohol.
Answer 3: No - if you are a learner driver.
Correct: Yes - always.

Name: DKT-049
Item Stem: What is your maximum speed limit if you are driving a vehicle with a GVM over 4.5 tonnes?
Answer 2: 90 km/h.
Correct: 90 km/h.

Name: DKT-055
Item Stem: If you are taking any sort of medicine, you should -
Answer 1: Find out from your doctor or chemist whether the medicine or drug will affect your driving and act accordingly.
Answer 2: Only drive during the day after taking the medicine or drug.
Answer 3: Only drive a motor car not a heavy vehicle.
Correct: Find out from your doctor or chemist whether the medicine or drug will affect your driving and act accordingly.

Name: DKT-027
Item Stem: You see a broken yellow line painted on the roadway adjacent to the kerb. What does it mean?
Answer 1: You may at any time, park along this part of the road for 1 hour only.
Answer 2: Clearway restrictions apply - you must not stop during the clearway hours.
Answer 3: Bicycle riders must ride along the yellow line.
Correct: Clearway restrictions apply - you must not stop during the clearway hours.

Name: DKT-059
Item Stem: This sign means you should -
Answer 1: Pass to the left of the sign.
Answer 2: Turn left at next street.
Answer 3: Drive carefully, roundabout ahead.
Correct: Turn left at next street.

Name: DKT-060
Item Stem: What does this sign mean?
Answer 1: All right lane traffic must turn right at the next intersection.
Answer 2: Right lane traffic may turn right or go straight ahead at the next intersection.
Answer 3: One way traffic ahead.
Correct: All right lane traffic must turn right at the next intersection.

Name: DKT-061
Item Stem: What does this here sign mean?
Answer 1: Traffic travels in each direction.
Answer 2: No turns permitted.
Answer 3: Double lane bridge ahead.
Correct: No turns permitted.

Name: DKT-062
Item Stem: What does this actual sign mean?
Answer 1: You must not turn to the right.
Answer 2: You may turn to the right.
Answer 3: You must give way to traffic on your right.
Correct: You must give way to traffic on your right.

Name: DKT-022
Item Stem: Where there are double dividing lines, you may park -
Answer 1: One metre from the dividing lines.
Answer 2: At least three metres from the dividing lines.
Answer 3: At least two metres from the dividing lines.
Correct: At least three metres from the dividing lines.

Name: DKT-011
Item Stem: You hold an unrestricted licence and are driving at 100 km/h in the country and pass this sign. What should you do?
Answer 1: For the next 5 kilometres you must not exceed 60 km/h unless you pass an end farm animals speed limit sign.
Answer 2: Slow down to a speed that will allow you to stop to avoid crashing into farm animals on the road.
Answer 3: You can continue to drive at 100 km/h if there are fences to stop farm animals from getting on the road.
Correct: Slow down to a speed that will allow you to stop to avoid crashing into farm animals on the road.

Name: DKT-032
Item Stem: If you are driving through a road work zone in the left hand lane and you see this sign you should -
Answer 1: Merge to the right and give way to other traffic.
Answer 2: Speed up to get in front of any cars travelling in the right hand lane.
Answer 3: Stop and wait for directions.
Correct: Merge to the right and give way to other traffic.

Name: DKT-008
Item Stem: Stop signs or flashing lights at railway crossings should always be obeyed, because -
Answer 1: Car brakes often fail.
Answer 2: Trains are fast, heavy and cannot stop quickly.
Answer 3: Pedestrians might be crossing.
Correct: Trains are fast, heavy and cannot stop quickly.

Name: DKT-058
Item Stem: When you see this sign you should -
Answer 1: Not drive beyond the sign.
Answer 2: Drive with caution.
Answer 3: Not pass another vehicle.
Correct: Not pass another vehicle.

Name: DKT-066_vietnamese
Item Stem: Thắt dây an toàn và ghế nâng cho trẻ em (ví dụ: viên nang trẻ em và ghế trẻ em) -
Answer 1: Phải luôn luôn được đeo đúng cách, và điều chỉnh chặt chẽ.

Name: DKT-063_vietnamese
Item Stem: Điều gì sẽ xảy ra nếu bạn bị bắt gian lận trong bài kiểm tra kiến thức?
Answer 1: Bạn sẽ không được phép làm bài kiểm tra khác trong 6 tuần.

Name: DKT-064_vietnamese
Item Stem: Điều gì sẽ xảy ra nếu bạn đề nghị một nhân viên kiểm tra hối lộ để vượt qua bài kiểm tra lái xe của bạn?

Answer 3: Không có gì, không có hình phạt.

Name: DKT-006_vietnamese
Item Stem: Trường hợp có bãi đậu xe kerbside song song, bạn có được phép đỗ xe đôi bên cạnh một chiếc xe đang đỗ không?
Answer 1: Không, không phải bất cứ lúc nào.
Answer 2: Có, nếu giao hàng.
Answer 3: Có, nếu không cản trở giao thông.
Correct: Không, không phải bất cứ lúc nào.

Name: DKT-040_vietnamese
Item Stem: Dấu hiệu này có nghĩa là gì trên hoặc gần một cây cầu?
Answer 1: Hãy chậm lại và chuẩn bị nhường đường cho các phương tiện đi ngược chiều.
Answer 2: Dừng lại mọi lúc trước khi qua cầu và chỉ nhường đường cho người đi bộ có thể băng qua.
Answer 3: Đừng vượt xe đang đi cùng chiều.
Correct: Dừng lại mọi lúc trước khi qua cầu và chỉ nhường đường cho người đi bộ có thể băng qua.

Name: DKT-001_vietnamese
Item Stem: Một người bạn cho bạn mượn xe của anh ấy. Nó rất ồn ào và thổi rất nhiều khói. Anh ta nói với bạn rằng chiếc xe đã được thông báo lỗi nhưng vẫn ổn khi lái nó. Những gì bạn nên làm?
Answer 1: Mượn xe, nhưng luôn lái nó dưới 10 km / h dưới giới hạn tốc độ.
Answer 2: Mượn xe nhưng chỉ lái xe trên đường phố, nơi xe sẽ không gây nguy hiểm cho người khác.
Answer 3: Trước khi bạn mượn xe hãy kiểm tra thông báo lỗi để chắc chắn rằng việc lái xe là hợp pháp.
Correct: Trước khi bạn mượn xe hãy kiểm tra thông báo lỗi để chắc chắn rằng việc lái xe là hợp pháp.

Name: DKT-023_vietnamese
Item Stem: Bạn có bắt buộc phải mang theo bằng lái xe mỗi khi lái xe không?
Answer 1: Không, được cấp phép là đủ.
Answer 2: Vâng.
Answer 3: Không, nó chỉ cần thiết trong những chuyến đi dài.
Correct: Vâng.

Name: DKT-016_vietnamese
Item Stem: Một người bạn cho bạn mượn một chiếc xe có chỗ ngồi cho mười hành khách. Loại giấy phép nào bạn cần để lái loại phương tiện này?
Answer 1: Một giấy phép xe cứng nhắc nặng.
Answer 2: Giấy phép xe buýt nhỏ.
Answer 3: Giấy phép xe.
Correct: Giấy phép xe.

Name: DKT-035_vietnamese
Item Stem: Trình điều khiển tạm thời P1 hoặc P2 có thể hướng dẫn một cách hợp pháp cho người học lái xe không?
Answer 1: Không.
Answer 2: Có, với điều kiện tài xế tạm thời đã giữ bằng lái P2 trong hơn 6 tháng.
Answer 3: Có, các tấm L và P1 hoặc P2 được cung cấp được hiển thị.
Correct: Có, với điều kiện tài xế tạm thời đã giữ bằng lái P2 trong hơn 6 tháng.

Name: DKT-036_vietnamese
Item Stem: Để chuyển sang giấy phép tạm thời P2, người lái xe tạm thời P1 phải có giấy phép P1 trong khoảng thời gian tối thiểu là -
Answer 1: 12 tháng.
Answer 2: 18 tháng.
Answer 3: 24 tháng.
Correct: 24 tháng.

Name: DKT-003_vietnamese
Item Stem: Bạn có được phép đỗ theo hướng mũi tên không?
Answer 1: Có, nếu bạn đang chở hai hoặc nhiều hành khách.
Answer 2: Có, với điều kiện không có taxi đang sử dụng khu vực.
Answer 3: Không, không phải bất cứ lúc nào.
Correct: Không, không phải bất cứ lúc nào.

Name: DKT-038_vietnamese
Item Stem: Nếu không có làn đường được đánh dấu trên đường, bạn nên lái xe -
Answer 1: Gần bên trái đường.
Answer 2: Bất cứ nơi nào trên đường của bạn.
Answer 3: Dọc giữa đường.
Correct: Gần bên trái đường.

Name: DKT-009_vietnamese
